# Communist Party of the Karelo-Finnish Soviet Socialist Republic

| founded          = 31 March – 2 April 1940
| dissolution      = 16 July 1956
| merged           = CPRSFSR
| standing_committee = Karelian Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union
| ideology         = CommunismMarxism–Leninism
| position         = Far-left
| country          = Russia
| national         = Communist Party of the Soviet Union
| first_secretary  = Gennady Kupriyanov Leonid Lubennikov
| flag             = Flag of the Karelo-Finnish SSR.svg
}}
The Communist Party of the Karelo-Finnish SSR (, ), initially known as the Communist Party (Bolshevik) of the Karelo-Finnish SSR, was the branch of the All-Union Communist Party/Communist Party of the Soviet Union in the Karelo-Finnish SSR (1940–1956).

Second Secretaries of the Party
Yuri Andropov was elected Second Secretary of the Central Committee in 1947.
